definition: volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
Dead Sea Scrolls

sentences.english: For many books of the Bible, we know who wrote it.
sentences.chinese: 對於聖經中的許多經卷，我們知道是誰寫的。

sentences.english: Remember which 'literature section' of the Bible a particular book belongs in.
sentences.chinese: 記住這一特殊經卷屬於聖經的哪個‘文學領域’。

sentences.english: Isaiah is one of the greatest books in the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 以賽亞書是聖經最重要的經卷之一。

sentences.english: Today's question is how these Buddhist scriptures in the White Horse Temple were brought back?
sentences.chinese: 白馬寺的經卷是由白馬怎麼帶回的呢？

sentences.english: Which books of the New Testament are letters?
sentences.chinese: 新約中哪些經卷是書信？

sentences.english: Whether Jewish or Christian, those 24 are the baseline common books.
sentences.chinese: 不論對於猶太教徒還是基督徒都是最基礎的經卷。

sentences.english: Rabi Greenberg gifts Sophie a mezuzah.
sentences.chinese: 格林伯格拉比送給索菲一個門柱經卷做禮物。

definition: Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang dynastic Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism
Kumarajiva c. 334-413, Buddhist monk and translator of Zen texts
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
scripture hall (Buddhism)
Vairocana, Buddha of supreme enlightenment
Chinese Buddhist school founded on the Buddhavatamsaka-mahavaipulya Sutra (Garland sutra)
radiance emanating from the head/halo
boundless life (expression of good wishes)/Amitayus, the Buddha of measureless life, good fortune and wisdom
protector deities of Buddhist law
(of a monk) to travel/itinerant
Mt Maiji Caves at Tianshui 天水, Gansu
pattra palm tree (Corypha umbraculifera), whose leaves were used as paper substitute for Buddhist sutras
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
calligraphic style of Liu Gongquan
Nagarjuna (Nagarjuna Bodhisattva)
fine silver
